classes.name: FTPClient
classes.description: Jakarta Commons Net FTP client wrapper

attributes.name: soLinger
attributes.description: Socket SO Linger , null if disabled

methods.name: enableSSL
methods.description: Enable SSL

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connect the client to an host

methods.name: login
methods.description: Login on the ftp server
methods.parameters: username: String, password: String, account: String

methods.name: executeCommand
methods.description: Execute command

methods.name: getFile
methods.description: Copy a file FROM a remote host TO the Automation Orchestrator Server.

methods.name: getString
methods.description: Get the content of a remote file.

methods.name: putFile
methods.description: Copy a file TO a remote host FROM the Automation Orchestrator Server.

methods.name: putString
methods.description: Put a string content to a remote file.

methods.name: listAll
methods.description: List files and directories in path.

methods.name: listFile
methods.description: List files ONLY in path.

methods.name: listDir
methods.description: List directories ONLY in path.

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Logout and disconnects the current session if open.

methods.name: getStatus
methods.description: The status information returned by the server.

methods.name: isAvailable
methods.description: Make various checks on the socket to test if it is available for use

methods.name: isConnected
methods.description: Returns true if the client is currently connected to a server

classes.name: IMAPClient
classes.description: Jakarta Commons Net IMAP client wrapper

attributes.name: soLinger
attributes.description: Socket SO Linger , null if disabled

methods.name: enableSSL
methods.description: Enable SSL

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connect the client to an host

methods.name: login
methods.description: Login to the IMAP server with the given username and password. You must first connect to the server with 'connect()' before attempting to login.

methods.name: logout
methods.description: Logout of the IMAP server. To fully disconnect from the server you must call 'disconnect()'

methods.name: close
methods.description: Send a CLOSE command to the server.

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the client from the server.

methods.name: noop
methods.description: Send a NOOP command to the IMAP server. This is useful for keeping connection alive.

methods.name: isAvailable
methods.description: Make various checks on the socket to test if it is available for use.

methods.name: isConnected
methods.description: Returns true if the client is currently connected to a server.

methods.name: append
methods.description: Send an APPEND command to the server.

methods.name: appendWithOptions
methods.description: Send an APPEND command to the server.
methods.parameters: mailboxName: String, flags: String, datetime: String

methods.name: capability
methods.description: Send a CAPABILITY command to the server.

methods.name: check
methods.description: Send a CHECK command to the server

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Send a COPY command to the server.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Send a CREATE command to the server.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Send a DELETE command to the server.

methods.name: examine
methods.description: Send a EXAMINE command to the server.

methods.name: expunge
methods.description: Send a EXPUNGE command to the server.

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Send a FETCH command to the server.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Send a LIST command to the server.

methods.name: lsub
methods.description: Send a LSUB command to the server.

methods.name: rename
methods.description: Send a RENAME command to the server.

methods.name: search
methods.description: Send a SEARCH command to the server.

methods.name: searchCharset
methods.description: Send a SEARCH command to the server.

methods.name: status
methods.description: Send a STATUS command to the server.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Send a SELECT command to the server.

methods.name: store
methods.description: Send a STORE command to the server.
methods.parameters: sequenceSet: String, itemNames: String, itemValues: String

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description: Send a SUBSCRIBE command to the server.

methods.name: unsubscribe
methods.description: Send a UNSUBSCRIBE command to the server.

methods.name: uid
methods.description: Send a UID command to the server.

methods.name: getReply
methods.description: Returns the reply to the last command sent to the server. The value is a single string containing all the reply lines including newlines.

methods.name: getReplyLines
methods.description: Returns an array of lines received as a reply to the last command sent to the server. The lines have end of lines truncated.

classes.name: POP3Client
classes.description: Jakarta Commons Net POP3 client wrapper

attributes.name: soLinger
attributes.description: Socket SO Linger , null if disabled

methods.name: enableSSL
methods.description: Enable SSL

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connect the client to an host

methods.name: login
methods.description: Login to the POP3 server with the given username and password. You must first connect to the server with 'connect()' before attempting to login.

methods.name: loginWithSecret
methods.description: Login to the POP3 server with the given username and authentication information. Use this method when connecting to a server requiring authentication using the APOP command. Because the timestamp produced in the greeting banner varies from server to server, it is not possible to consistently extract the information. Therefore, after connecting to the server, you must get the 'output' sttribute and parse out the timestamp information yourself.
methods.parameters: username: String, timestamp: String, secret: String

methods.name: listMessages
methods.description: List all messages. If there are no messages, this method returns a zero length array. If the list attempt fails, it returns null.

methods.name: logout
methods.description: Logout of the POP3 server. To fully disconnect from the server you must call 'disconnect()'

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the client from the server.

methods.name: noop
methods.description: Send a NOOP command to the POP3 server. This is useful for keeping connection alive.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Reset the POP3 session. This is useful for undoing any message deletions that may have been performed.

methods.name: isAvailable
methods.description: Make various checks on the socket to test if it is available for use

methods.name: isConnected
methods.description: Returns true if the client is currently connected to a server

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: return message id in current session

methods.name: getHeader
methods.description: Get the header value i.e. ("Subject","Date","From",...)

methods.name: deleteFromServer
methods.description: Delete a message from the POP3 server. The message is only marked for deletion by the server. If you decide to unmark the message, you must issues a 'reset()' command on POP3Client. Messages marked for deletion are only deleted by the server on POP3Client 'logout()'.

attributes.name: soLinger
attributes.description: Socket SO Linger , null if disabled

methods.name: enableSSL
methods.description: Enable SSL

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connect the client to an host

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnect the client

methods.name: sendBinary
methods.description: Get an OID value in the current session

methods.name: sendString
methods.description: Get an OID value in the current session

methods.name: waitForData
methods.description: return true if data are available or false if timeout

methods.name: receiveAsString
methods.description: Get a response as string

methods.name: receiveAsBinary
methods.description: Get a response as an arrayof number

methods.name: isAvailable
methods.description: Make various checks on the socket to test if it is available for use

methods.name: isConnected
methods.description: Returns true if the client is currently connected to a server
